answers.answer: I'm 38 weeks and this happened to me today. At my doctors appointment today they had to run a few test on me to make sure I didn't have preeclampsia because my blood pressure was higher than usual for some reason. Idk the results yet but I'm not scared. I'm pretty close to the end of my pregnancy. Me and my doctor talked already, if it turns out that the test comes out positive then they will induce me and I won't be able to carry her for the 40 weeks as I planned but hey the doctors know what they ate doing so I trust every decision .
I'm only 33 weeks so I'm worried I'll have to have him too early. :/

I have that too today..my blood pressure is so high I have to admit in labor and deliveey to monitor it.im 36 weeks 1 day now.baby is fine, no protien in my urine, blood sugar is fine.but just the blood pressure. This is second time it happened. The 1st one was lastweek.so today they check my blood work and everything is fine, so they let me go home.but I have to save my pee 24 hour and go back there tomorrow and give it to the laboratory for more checking.so I dnt know.i might have here early too.i have schedule for csection on jan 2nd.but probably earlier than that because of my blood pressure is high..just try to relax I guess. Watch the sodium intake.
Is it a diagnosed condition that can be treated with medicine to prevent having a baby early? Good luck to you ladies!
The only cure to preeclampsia is delivering your baby
They ruled out pre eclampsia, they don't think that's what it is.

I know some of them have meds but its depends in ur doctors, but mostly is to deliver the baby early.or monitor u all the time.nst, urine check,blood work.and they mite also check if possible of Hellp syndrome, then they have to get the baby out early.

Ive also been experiencing high bloodpressure since roughly 35 weeks or so im now 38 weeks almost and all my tests come back normal, my baby is healthy active and yet my bloodpressure is still high which could be just it being the end of my pregnancy my DR told me id probably have to be induced at 38 weeks to keep baby and i out of harms way due to the fact high bloodpressure can cause stroke/heartattacks, i do know they can maintain bloodpressure with medications if pre-eclampsia and hypertension is ruled out
Thanks ladies. i don't know whether to be worried or not lol.  Any other mommies dealt with this before?

I started having high blood pressure a few months ago, & I'm now 21+5. They always have to take it 2 or 3 times but haven't done a thing about it. I don't have protein in my urine so they're not thinking preeclampsia, but it stinks not knowing what is causing it. Try to keep hydrated & eat less salty foods, salt raises your bp as well.

question: This will be long, sorry.  I'm 33 weeks and I had an ultrasound today.  The baby is completely healthy and weighs 4 pounds and 15 ounces. He's head down as well. What I'm worried about is my midwife had my blood pressure taken 3 times.  Twice while sitting up (it was extremely high) and the third time was while I was lying down, that reading was normal. She still seemed worried so she drew my blood and scheduled me for a stress test Monday. She said to take it easy until then.  They ruled out pre eclampsia. So I'm wondering if anyone else has had to deal with this? What was it? Did you make it to full term?
title: High blood pressure, worried.
